ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the past month, I have been worrying about someone trying to harm me.
Notes: 0 = None of the time; 1 = Rarely; 2 = Some of the time; 3 = Often; 4 = All of the time; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: In the past month, Anything and everything has set my mind thinking about people trying to upset me.
Notes: 0 = None of the time; 1 = Rarely; 2 = Some of the time; 3 = Often; 4 = All of the time; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: In the past month, It has been hard to clear my head of suspicions.
Notes: 0 = None of the time; 1 = Rarely; 2 = Some of the time; 3 = Often; 4 = All of the time; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: In the past month, Worries about someone trying to harm me have been really hard to control.
Notes: 0 = None of the time; 1 = Rarely; 2 = Some of the time; 3 = Often; 4 = All of the time; -999 = Missing

ElementDescription: In the past month, Thinking about the possible attacks on me has made me feel stressed.
Notes: 0 = None of the time; 1 = Rarely; 2 = Some of the time; 3 = Often; 4 = All of the time; -999 = Missing
Sum of the five PWQ items; -999= Missing
